title: Biology Lab
subtitle: Interactive Biology Experiments
description: Learn biology through interactive experiments. Explore cells, body systems, photosynthesis, and food chains!

cell_structure.title: Cell Structure
cell_structure.description: Explore the parts of a cell and their functions
cell_structure.click_parts: Click on different cell parts to learn more:

nucleus.name: Nucleus
nucleus.function: The control center of the cell. Contains DNA and controls all cell activities.

mitochondria.name: Mitochondria
mitochondria.function: The powerhouse of the cell. Produces energy (ATP) through cellular respiration.

ribosome.name: Ribosome
ribosome.function: Protein factory. Reads mRNA and builds proteins for the cell.

membrane.name: Cell Membrane
membrane.function: Protective barrier that controls what enters and exits the cell.

cytoplasm.name: Cytoplasm
cytoplasm.function: Gel-like substance that fills the cell and holds all organelles in place.

cell_structure.tip: All living things are made of cells! Cells are the basic building blocks of life.

body_systems.title: Body Systems
body_systems.description: Learn about different systems in the human body
body_systems.select_system: Select a body system to explore:

circulatory.name: Circulatory System
circulatory.function: Transports blood, oxygen, and nutrients throughout the body

respiratory.name: Respiratory System
respiratory.function: Brings oxygen into the body and removes carbon dioxide

digestive.name: Digestive System
digestive.function: Breaks down food and absorbs nutrients

nervous.name: Nervous System
nervous.function: Controls and coordinates all body activities

skeletal.name: Skeletal System
skeletal.function: Supports the body, protects organs, and allows movement

body_systems.tip: All body systems work together to keep us healthy and alive!

photosynthesis.title: Photosynthesis
photosynthesis.description: See how plants make food from sunlight
photosynthesis.adjust_factors: Adjust the factors needed for photosynthesis:
photosynthesis.tip: Plants need sunlight, water, and CO‚ÇÇ to make their own food (glucose) and produce oxygen for us!

food_chain.title: Food Chain
food_chain.description: Understand the flow of energy in ecosystems
food_chain.click_organisms: Click on organisms to learn their role:

sun.name: Sun
sun.role: The ultimate source of energy for all life on Earth

plant.name: Producer (Plant)
plant.role: Makes its own food through photosynthesis using sunlight

herbivore.name: Primary Consumer (Herbivore)
herbivore.role: Eats plants to get energy. Examples: Deer, Rabbit, Cow

carnivore.name: Secondary Consumer (Carnivore)
carnivore.role: Eats herbivores to get energy. Examples: Lion, Wolf, Fox

decomposer.name: Decomposer
decomposer.role: Breaks down dead organisms and returns nutrients to the soil

food_chain.tip: Energy flows from the sun through plants to animals. Decomposers recycle nutrients back to the soil!
